dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Letitia James is really going after the Trump Organization with this new filing, isn't she?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Letitia James is really going after the Trump Organization with this new filing, isn't she?
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: According to the 68-page filing, James is investigating whether the Trump Organization misled investors by inflating the value of its assets.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Oh absolutely, and it's a massive 68-page document too. She's not holding back.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Oh absolutely, and it's a massive sixty eight-page document too. She's not holding back.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: According to the 68-page filing, James is investigating whether the Trump Organization misled investors by inflating the value of its assets.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Right? And she's specifically targeting Ivanka Trump to sit for an interview—calling her "tangentially involved" in some of these transactions.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Right? And she's specifically targeting Ivanka Trump to sit for an interview-calling her tangentially involved in some of these transactions.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: James is also seeking for a judge to compel the Trump Organization to comply with subpoenas for its financial information, and to force Eric Trump, the companys executive vice president, to sit for an interview.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, that's uh, pretty bold. And it's not just her—she's also going after Rudy Giuliani and Sheri Dillon from what I saw.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, that's uh, pretty bold. And it's not just her-she's also going after Rudy Giuliani and Sheri Dillon from what I saw.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: James also seeks to force two people connected to the Trump Organizations work to sit for interviews: land-use lawyer Charles Martabano and Sheri Dillon, a tax representative.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Mhm, and the properties under scrutiny—Mar-a-Lago, 40 Wall Street, even a golf club in Seattle. It feels like she's casting a really wide net here.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Mhm, and the properties under scrutiny-Mar-a-Lago, forty Wall Street, even a golf club in Seattle. It feels like she's casting a really wide net here.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The investigation also covers an upstate New York estate called Seven Springs, which the attorney general calls significant, along with 40 Wall Street in Manhattan, Trump Tower Chicago and Trumps Los Angeles golf club.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: And that Seven Springs estate valuation—they're saying it was inflated to help claim a $2.1 billion tax deduction back in 2015. That's… huge.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: And that Seven Springs estate valuation-they're saying it was inflated to help claim a two point one dollars billion tax deduction back in twenty fifteen. That's... huge.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Seven Springs valuation was also used to claim a $21.1 million tax deduction 2015 after the Trump Organization donated part of its 212 acres for conservation efforts.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, and Eric Trump already sat for an interview on July 22nd, but he hasn't responded to this latest filing yet.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, and Eric Trump already sat for an interview on July twenty second, but he hasn't responded to this latest filing yet.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Eric Trump, the complaint says, was scheduled to sit for an interview on July 22. He backed out two days prior, and the Trump Organization has since said he will not sit for an interview because of those rights afforded to every individual under the Constitution.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Meanwhile, Trump himself spoke at the DNC this morning but hasn't said a word about any of this. You think he'll address it?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Meanwhile, Trump himself spoke at the D N C this morning but hasn't said a word about any of this. You think he'll address it?
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Before James filed her complaint, President Trump spoke at the RNC Monday morning after being renominated for the Oval Office and has not yet commented on the filing.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Oh, he'll address it eventually—you know he can't resist. But James says the Clinton Foundation has been cooperating for months, which is interesting.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Oh, he'll address it eventually-you know he can't resist. But James says the Clinton Foundation has been cooperating for months, which is interesting.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, she emphasized that they've been working with her investigation, unlike how they're framing the Trump Org's response.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, she emphasized that they've been working with her investigation, unlike how they're framing the Trump Org's response.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: It's all so messy. And with the DNC happening at the same time, the timing feels… intentional, doesn't it?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: It's all so messy. And with the D N C happening at the same time, the timing feels... intentional, doesn't it?
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: And it comes as the Republican National Convention kicks off, when President Trump must make his case for reelection in November.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: One hundred percent. This is political theater meets legal showdown.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: One hundred percent. This is political theater meets legal showdown.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: And we're all just watching with popcorn.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: And we're all just watching with popcorn.

HostA: Letitia James is really going after the Trump Organization with this new filing, isn't she?
HostB: Oh absolutely, and it's a massive 68-page document too. She's not holding back.
HostA: Right? And she’s specifically targeting Ivanka Trump to sit for an interview—calling her "tangentially involved" in some of these transactions.
HostB: Yeah, that’s uh, pretty bold. And it’s not just her—she’s also going after Rudy Giuliani and Sheri Dillon from what I saw.
HostA: Mhm, and the properties under scrutiny—Mar-a-Lago, 40 Wall Street, even a golf club in Seattle. It feels like she’s casting a really wide net here.
HostB: And that Seven Springs estate valuation—they’re saying it was inflated to help claim a $2.1 billion tax deduction back in 2015. That’s… huge.
HostA: Yeah, and Eric Trump already sat for an interview on July 22nd, but he hasn’t responded to this latest filing yet.
HostB: Meanwhile, Trump himself spoke at the DNC this morning but hasn’t said a word about any of this. You think he’ll address it?
HostA: Oh, he’ll address it eventually—you know he can’t resist. But James says the Clinton Foundation has been cooperating for months, which is interesting.
HostB: Yeah, she emphasized that they’ve been working with her investigation, unlike how they’re framing the Trump Org’s response.
HostA: It’s all so messy. And with the DNC happening at the same time, the timing feels… intentional, doesn’t it?
HostB: One hundred percent. This is political theater meets legal showdown.
HostA: And we’re all just watching with popcorn.
